H0.text: Inner core is the thinnest layer of Earth.

H1.text: Crust is the thinnest layer of Earth.

H2.text: The outer core is the thinnest layer of Earth.

H3.text: The mantle is the thinnest layer of Earth.

A4.text: The average thickness of the crust is about 15–20 km (9.3–12.4 mi).

A5.text: Earth's crust is its thick outer shell of rock, comprising less than one percent of the planet's radius and volume.
